header.comment: This configuration file was automatically created by GParserBuilder

minSize.comment: The minimum size of the triangle in percent of the canvas

maxSize.comment: The maximum size of the triangle in percent of the canvas

startSize.comment: The start size of the triangle in percent of the canvas

minOpaqueness.comment: The minimum allowed opaqueness of triangles

maxOpaqueness.comment: The maximum allowed opaqueness of triangles

adaptAdProb.comment: Determines the rate of adaption of adProb. Set to 0, if you do not need this feature

minAdProb.comment: The lower allowed boundary for adProb-variation

maxAdProb.comment: The upper allowed boundary for adProb-variation

adProb.comment: The probability for random adaptions of values in evolutionary algorithms

sigma.comment: The sigma for gauss-adaption in ES

minSigma.comment: minSigma must be positive and smaller than maxSigma

maxSigma.comment: maxSigma must be positive and larger than minSigma

sigmaSigma.comment: Influences the self-adaption of gauss-mutation in ES

bgRed.comment: Otherwise the allowed value range is [0.,1.]

bgGreen.comment: Otherwise the allowed value range is [0.,1.]

bgBlue.comment: Otherwise the allowed value range is [0.,1.]

nTriangles.comment: The number of triangles that will constitute

alphaSort.comment: Whether triangles should be sorted according

evalPolicy.comment: Specifies which strategy should be used to calculate the evaluation:
0 (a.k.a. USESIMPLEEVALUATION): Always call the evaluation function, even for invalid solutions
1 (a.k.a. USEWORSTCASEFORINVALID) : Assign the worst possible value to our fitness and evaluate only valid solutions
2 (a.k.a. USESIGMOID): Assign a multiple of m_validity_level and sigmoid barrier to invalid solutions, apply a sigmoid function to valid evaluations
3 (a.k.a. USEWORSTKNOWNVALIDFORINVALID): Assign "invalidityLevel*worstKnownValid" to invalid individuals, using normal evaluation otherwise

steepness.comment: When using a sigmoid function to transform the individual's fitness,
this parameter influences the steepness of the function at the center of the sigmoid.
The parameter must have a value > 0.

barrier.comment: When using a sigmoid function to transform the individual's fitness,
this parameter sets the upper/lower boundary of the sigmoid.
The parameter must have a value > 0.

maxUnsuccessfulAdaptions.comment: The maximum number of unsuccessful adaptions in a row for one call to adapt()

maxRetriesUntilValid.comment: The maximum allowed number of retries during the
adaption of individuals until a valid solution was found
A parameter set is considered to be "valid" if

maximize.comment: Specifies whether the individual should be maximized (1) or minimized (0)
Note that minimization is the by far most common option.

perItemCrossOverProbability.comment: The likelihood for two data items to be exchanged
